alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Oneida, northwestern Madison and central Onondaga Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1132 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camillus, or 7 miles south of Baldwinsville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Rome, De Witt, Sullivan, Van Buren, Oneida, Lenox, North Syracuse and Solvay. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 33 and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 16A and 29 South. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for central New York.

area.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida
